tabs.title: 0: Introduction
description: This is a simple app to visualize and communicate the content of a knowledge base in the RDF format. The project is open source and we welcome all who is interested to participate. Please find the Github repository [here](https://github.com/MadsHolten/sparql-visualizer).

The frontend of the app is based on [Angular](https://angular.io/), [material design](https://material.angular.io/) and [D3](https://d3js.org/) and the default local triplestore is based on [rdfstore](https://github.com/antoniogarrote/rdfstore-js). Since rdfstore does not fully support SPARQL 1.1 and has no reasoning capabilities, it is recommended to use a [Stardog](https://www.stardog.com/) based triplestore instead.
See the readme on the [Github page](https://github.com/MadsHolten/sparql-visualizer) for more details about using a local Stardog database.
### PROPS ontology discussion and overview

This app allows both the AECO research community and industry to propose data structures and use cases related to **building element properties** via small RDF snippets and example SPARQL queries. Simply modify the data.json file according to your wishes and knowledge about building element properties in a Linked Building Data environment. You can add multiple tabs to a data.json file, each containing at least a **`title`** and a **`description`**, and optionally a **`triples`** and a **`query`** component. The triples should be in Turtle syntax (.ttl). Please add all **prefixes** in the query tab, to allow maximum readability of the query results. For the triples and query, please keep the samples as **concise** as possible to allow a constructive discussion about several modelling approaches.

If you have a relevant use case or modelling approach, you can make a post in the [PROPS issue](https://github.com/w3c-lbd-cg/props/issues) of the sparql-visualizer Github page. You can refer to your data.json example directly, by placing the data.json file on your Dropbox or Github page, and create a Direct Link respectively raw Github URL. See Github readme of [sparql-visualizer](https://github.com/MadsHolten/sparql-visualizer) for more details. All relevant data.json files submitted will be assembled in a separate folder of the [sparql-visualizer](https://github.com/MadsHolten/sparql-visualizer) Github repository and used during the **LBD call of the 12th of March** that will focus on the PROPS ontology.
When discussing the development of the PROPS ontology, the following things can be considered:
* The ways of modelling building element properties in a uniform way

* The origin of the properties (name, definitions, restrictions, translations, etc.). The origin can be the IFC schema via [ifcOWL](http://ifcowl.openbimstandards.org/), it can come from Wikidata or some other shared database. On the other hand, they can also be custom made? If so, the data structure should allow to define new properties.
* Query performance
* Reasoning issues
* How to deal with units for the properties
* grouping of properties (e.g. in IFC property sets)
* Dependencies of properties
* Versioning of property values (see e.g. [OPM](https://github.com/w3c-lbd-cg/opm))

tabs.title: 1: Overview BIMSO and BIMDO
tabs.query:
PREFIX rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX inst: <https://example.org/projectXX/>
PREFIX BIMDO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Design_Ontology#>
PREFIX BIMSO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Shared_Ontology#>
PREFIX unit: <http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/>
PREFIX qudt: <http://qudt.org/schema/qudt#>
PREFIX quantitykind: <http://qudt.org/vocab/quantitykind/>
PREFIX fc: <http://www.freeclass.eu/freeclass_v1#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>

CONSTRUCT
WHERE {
	?s ?p ?o
}
description: This tab gives some examples regarding the use of building element properties, as used in the BIM Shared Ontology (BIMSO) and BIM Design Ontology (BIMDO).
The example demonstrates the use of units (QUDT ontology), but I'm no expert on this. **Controlling of the modelling concerning units is appreciated.**
The qudt vocabulary regarding volume units is coming from [qudt-units-space-and-time](http://qudt.org/2.0/vocab/VOCAB_QUDT-UNITS-SPACE-AND-TIME-v2.0.ttl).
### Discussion
#### Pro
* hybrid usage of data type (quantitative) and object properties (qualitative), but only for material properties
* Units defined in an ontology can be used (here demo with QUDT)
#### Contra
* The BIMSO and BIMDO ontology is not publicly available.
* No qualitative-quantitative properties devision for properties of the building element itself (only data type properties)
* Query execution time
### Documentation
* Niknam, M., & Karshenas, S. (2017). A shared ontology approach to semantic representation of BIM data. Automation in Construction, 80, 22â€“36. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.autcon.2017.03.013

tabs.title: 2: BIMSO and BIMDO - data type properties (direct)
tabs.query:
PREFIX rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX inst: <https://example.org/projectXX/>
PREFIX BIMDO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Design_Ontology#>
PREFIX BIMSO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Shared_Ontology#>
PREFIX unit: <http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/>
PREFIX qudt: <http://qudt.org/schema/qudt#>
PREFIX quantitykind: <http://qudt.org/vocab/quantitykind/>
PREFIX fc: <http://www.freeclass.eu/freeclass_v1#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>

CONSTRUCT
WHERE {
	?s a BIMSO:B2010101 ;
		BIMDO:hasIdentity ?o1 ;
		BIMDO:hasDescription ?o2 .
}
description: In this tab, the usage of **data type properties** that are **directly** connected to a building element, is demonstrated.

tabs.title: 3: BIMSO and BIMDO - data type properties (indirect)
tabs.query:
PREFIX rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX inst: <https://example.org/projectXX/>
PREFIX BIMDO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Design_Ontology#>
PREFIX BIMSO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Shared_Ontology#>
PREFIX unit: <http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/>
PREFIX qudt: <http://qudt.org/schema/qudt#>
PREFIX quantitykind: <http://qudt.org/vocab/quantitykind/>
PREFIX fc: <http://www.freeclass.eu/freeclass_v1#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>

CONSTRUCT
WHERE {
	?s a BIMSO:B2010101 ;
		BIMDO:hasVolume ?prop1 ;
		BIMDO:hasMaterial ?mat .
	?prop1 ?p1 ?o1 .
	?mat ?quantProp ?prop2 .
	?prop2 a BIMDO:MaterialQuantitativeProperty ;
?p2 ?o2 .
}
description:
In this tab, the usage of **data type properties** that are **indirectly** connected to a building element, is demonstrated. 
They go via a directly connected object property starting from the building element, or via a material used in the building element. 

If the object property is used via the material, the object of that triple is of class `BIMDO:MaterialQuantitativeProperty`

tabs.title: 4: BIMSO and BIMDO - object properties (indirect)
tabs.query:
PREFIX rdf:  <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX inst: <https://example.org/projectXX/>
PREFIX BIMDO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Design_Ontology#>
PREFIX BIMSO: <http://www.marquette.edu/BIM_Shared_Ontology#>
PREFIX unit: <http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/>
PREFIX qudt: <http://qudt.org/schema/qudt#>
PREFIX quantitykind: <http://qudt.org/vocab/quantitykind/>
PREFIX fc: <http://www.freeclass.eu/freeclass_v1#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>

CONSTRUCT
WHERE {
	?s a BIMSO:B2010101 ;
		BIMDO:hasMaterial ?mat .
	?mat ?quantProp ?prop2 .
	?prop2 a BIMDO:MaterialQualitativeProperty ;
		?p2 ?o2 .
}
description:
In this tab, the usage of **object properties** that are **indirectly** connected to a building element, is demonstrated. 
They seem to be only available for properties of materials. 

If the object property is used via the material, the object of that triple is of class `BIMDO:MaterialQualitativeProperty`
